mozilla.components.ui.autocomplete

Class InlineAutocompleteEditText

  • mozilla.components.ui.autocomplete.InlineAutocompleteEditText

  • public class InlineAutocompleteEditText

    A UI edit text component which supports inline autocompletion.

    The background color of autocomplete spans can be configured using the custom autocompleteBackgroundColor attribute e.g. app:autocompleteBackgroundColor="#ffffff".

    A filter listener (see InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnFilterListener) needs to be attached to provide autocomplete results. It will be invoked when the input text changes. The listener gets direct access to this component (via its view parameter), so it can call {@link applyAutocompleteResult} in return.

    A commit listener (see InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnCommitListener) can be attached which is invoked when the user selected the result i.e. is done editing.

    Various other listeners can be attached to enhance default behaviour e.g. InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnSelectionChangedListener and InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnWindowsFocusChangeListener which will be invoked in response to InlineAutocompleteEditText.onSelectionChanged and InlineAutocompleteEditText.onWindowFocusChanged respectively (see also InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnTextChangeListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnSelectionChangedListener, and InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnWindowsFocusChangeListener).

    See Also:
    InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnFilterListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnCommitListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnSelectionChangedListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnWindowsFocusChangeListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.onSelectionChanged, InlineAutocompleteEditText.onWindowFocusChanged, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnTextChangeListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnSelectionChangedListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnWindowsFocusChangeListener

      Code to handle deleting autocomplete first when backspacing. If there is no autocomplete text, both removeAutocomplete() and commitAutocomplete() are no-ops and return false. Therefore we can use them here without checking explicitly if we have autocomplete text or not.

      • InlineAutocompleteEditText

        public InlineAutocompleteEditText(android.content.Context ctx,
                                  android.util.AttributeSet attrs,
                                  int defStyleAttr)

        A UI edit text component which supports inline autocompletion.

        The background color of autocomplete spans can be configured using the custom autocompleteBackgroundColor attribute e.g. app:autocompleteBackgroundColor="#ffffff".

        A filter listener (see InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnFilterListener) needs to be attached to provide autocomplete results. It will be invoked when the input text changes. The listener gets direct access to this component (via its view parameter), so it can call {@link applyAutocompleteResult} in return.

        A commit listener (see InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnCommitListener) can be attached which is invoked when the user selected the result i.e. is done editing.

        Various other listeners can be attached to enhance default behaviour e.g. InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnSelectionChangedListener and InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnWindowsFocusChangeListener which will be invoked in response to InlineAutocompleteEditText.onSelectionChanged and InlineAutocompleteEditText.onWindowFocusChanged respectively (see also InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnTextChangeListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnSelectionChangedListener, and InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnWindowsFocusChangeListener).

      • InlineAutocompleteEditText

        public InlineAutocompleteEditText(android.content.Context ctx)

        A UI edit text component which supports inline autocompletion.

        The background color of autocomplete spans can be configured using the custom autocompleteBackgroundColor attribute e.g. app:autocompleteBackgroundColor="#ffffff".

        A filter listener (see InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnFilterListener) needs to be attached to provide autocomplete results. It will be invoked when the input text changes. The listener gets direct access to this component (via its view parameter), so it can call {@link applyAutocompleteResult} in return.

        A commit listener (see InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnCommitListener) can be attached which is invoked when the user selected the result i.e. is done editing.

        Various other listeners can be attached to enhance default behaviour e.g. InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnSelectionChangedListener and InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnWindowsFocusChangeListener which will be invoked in response to InlineAutocompleteEditText.onSelectionChanged and InlineAutocompleteEditText.onWindowFocusChanged respectively (see also InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnTextChangeListener, InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnSelectionChangedListener, and InlineAutocompleteEditText.setOnWindowsFocusChangeListener).

        public void applyAutocompleteResult(InlineAutocompleteEditText.AutocompleteResult result)

        Applies the provided result by updating the current autocomplete text and selection, if any.

        Parameters:
        result - the class InlineAutocompleteEditText.AutocompleteResult to apply

      • onCreateInputConnection

        public android.view.inputmethod.InputConnection onCreateInputConnection(android.view.inputmethod.EditorInfo outAttrs)

        Code to handle deleting autocomplete first when backspacing. If there is no autocomplete text, both removeAutocomplete() and commitAutocomplete() are no-ops and return false. Therefore we can use them here without checking explicitly if we have autocomplete text or not.

        Also turns off text prediction for private mode tabs.

      • onKeyPreIme
